intro: Hedyotis taiwanensis, commonly known as the Taiwan strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture and dark green color. The small white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in late spring to early summer.
